oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dean Hayes oral history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hayes, Dean
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpts of an oral history with Dean Hayes, track coach for Middle Tennessee State University. Hayes shares memories of coaching experiences, race relations, women's issues, and general athletics at the university.
1. Experiences of black athletes during the 1960s -- 2. Dixie Controversy -- 3. Experiences of disabled athletes -- 4. Murphy Center indoor track
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dixie Controversy; Disabled students; Murphy Center

Coaches (Athletics); Coaching (Athletics); Track and field; Race relations; Racism; College integration; School mascots; Athletic fields; People with visual disabilities; People with disabilities; Women; Women college students; Middle Tennessee State University
